messages: 4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:39): hi all - anyone using vim in Terminal?
4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:39): i'm having confusing function key problems
375c33ae7e81ac04971c6d5bebd6b38b (18:41): I don't use the fkeys in vim.
375c33ae7e81ac04971c6d5bebd6b38b (18:41): They're actually used for stuff? I didn't even know.
4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:41): i've done it to aid usability emacs<->vim similar function key mappins
375c33ae7e81ac04971c6d5bebd6b38b (18:42): Well, if you're on a laptop you may need to press down the Fn modifier depending on your setup.
375c33ae7e81ac04971c6d5bebd6b38b (18:42): That's about as much as I know.
4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:42): no function key strings are definitely being sent
4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:42): emacs recognises them, and vim partially does too

4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:43): using vim in either Terminal or X11.app/Xterm, function keys aren't recognised properly. Emacs recognises them fine, vim does in cmdline mode but not in regular (normal) mode. wondering if anyone here's using vim with function key mappings, and if so, how they got it to play nice.
55e1bca4ba12a925ed08338f8f82a624 (18:44): I take it #vim didn't shed any light?
4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:44): they're rather unresponsive in there i'm afraid
4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:44): looking like usenet's the best bet at the moment
4bbae18312fb55d3c9b7c6588db43391 (18:45): you can of course invert that -- i have fn to access volume, etc. and the function keys are there without the need for a modifier
55e1bca4ba12a925ed08338f8f82a624 (18:45): zpg: I have no problems mapping the F keys
375c33ae7e81ac04971c6d5bebd6b38b (18:46): Maybe you need to update it?
55e1bca4ba12a925ed08338f8f82a624 (18:46): and I pressed F2 and it worked just fine
55e1bca4ba12a925ed08338f8f82a624 (18:46): I'm using VIM - Vi IMproved 6.2 (2003 Jun 1, compiled Jan 13 2006 11:36:16)
